metadata.synopsis: Dialog with Sorcerous Sundries' clerk Rolan. He will explain how Lorroakan is neglecting him in his search for the Nightsong. Player can ask Rolan to make a portal to Lorroakan.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Interact with Rolan in Sorcerous Sundries. Location aprox: -1730; 26; 592

8.speaker: Rolan
8.text: Welcome to Sorcerous Sundries, where every item carries the personal guarantee of Lorroakan, Immortal Master of Ramazith's Tower. How can I help you?

47.speaker: Player
47.context: NodeContext: slightly annoyed, emphasis on 'our'. Clearly unhappy.

42.speaker: Rolan
42.text: Of course - but Master Lorroakan has yet to share the fruits of our labour with me. Apparently I'm 'not ready'.
42.context: NodeContext: slightly annoyed, emphasis on 'our'. Clearly unhappy.

20.speaker: Player
20.text: I'm surprised you're behind the counter, and not up in the tower.

64.speaker: Rolan
64.text: And this is where I shall stay, apparently. Immortality has not improved Master Lorroakan's temperament.

0.speaker: Rolan
0.text: It is, rather. Master Lorroakan has us keep it to a high standard.

108.speaker: Rolan
108.text: I'm his apprentice. In addition to attending to the shop, I'll one day enter his tutelage.

16.speaker: Player
16.text: That man outside seemed quite irate.
16.context: NodeContext: rolls eyes, snooty and condescending

69.speaker: Rolan
69.text: Master Lorroakan has a contract out to any idiot with legs to find the Nightsong. Aradin is one such idiot.
69.context: NodeContext: rolls eyes, snooty and condescending

13.speaker: Player
13.context: NodeContext: A bit subdued and defeated while masking that with a normal cadence.

2.speaker: Rolan
2.text: He's the most powerful wizard in Baldur's Gate. And I am his apprentice.
2.context: NodeContext: A bit subdued and defeated while masking that with a normal cadence.

138.speaker: Player
138.text: I've heard rumours about Lorroakan's 'teaching'. Or lack of it. His students are no more than glorified shopkeeps.
138.context: NodeContext: A bit subdued and defeated while masking that with a normal cadence.

100.speaker: Gale
100.text: I've heard rumours about Lorroakan's 'teaching'. Or lack of it. His students are no more than glorified shopkeeps.
100.context: NodeContext: A bit subdued and defeated while masking that with a normal cadence.

80.speaker: Player
80.text: You must be here to shop. I am sundries, while Tolna deals with tomes.
80.context: NodeContext: A bit subdued and defeated while masking that with a normal cadence.

96.speaker: Rolan
96.text: You must be here to shop. I am sundries, while Tolna deals with tomes.
96.context: NodeContext: A bit subdued and defeated while masking that with a normal cadence.

131.speaker: Rolan
131.text: Or... are you perhaps another 'adventurer' with information on the 'Nightsong'?
131.context: NodeContext: A bit subdued and defeated while masking that with a normal cadence.

79.speaker: Player
79.text: I might be here about Nightsong.

63.speaker: Rolan
63.text: If you've got information, Master Lorroakan will want to speak to you immediately. He speaks of almost nothing else than the Nightsong's retrieval.

32.speaker: Rolan
32.text: Head upstairs to find the way into his tower. But be careful - mistakes are always punished around here.

66.speaker: Player
66.text: I know Nightsong, actually. Or did at least.

116.speaker: Player
116.text: Nightsong? She's in my camp right now.

119.speaker: Player
119.text: I have to ask - what happened to your face?

89.speaker: Player
89.text: You look familiar. Were you in the druid's grove?
89.context: NodeContext: A bit subdued and defeated while masking that with a normal cadence.

14.speaker: Rolan
14.text: Perhaps. I stopped by many huts and hamlets on my way here. Master Lorroakan invited me to be his apprentice.
14.context: NodeContext: A bit subdued and defeated while masking that with a normal cadence.

49.speaker: Rolan
49.context: NodeContext: looks up, sees player - utterly furious

82.speaker: Player
82.text: It's good to see you too, Rolan.

48.speaker: Rolan
48.text: Please, just make your purchase and go. I don't have energy for anything else.

85.speaker: Player
85.text: Let me see what's on offer.

78.speaker: Player
78.text: I want to speak to whoever's in charge around here.

142.speaker: Player
142.text: Gods, what happened to your face?

88.speaker: Player
88.text: I know the marks of subjugation. Your face - what happened?

118.speaker: Player
118.text: I know a beating when I see one. Who knocked you about?

128.speaker: Player
128.text: Rolan. How are you faring without Cal and Lia?

143.speaker: Rolan
143.text: Life goes on, doesn't it. Whether you want it to or not.

57.speaker: Rolan
57.context: NodeContext: looks up, sees player - utterly furious

99.speaker: Player
99.text: Calm down, Rolan. I'm not here for you.

41.speaker: Rolan
41.text: I should hope not. After you left Cal and Lia to die, I never want to see your face again.

37.speaker: Rolan
37.text: If you insist on making a purchase, hurry up and do it.

109.speaker: Player
109.text: Gods - what happened to your face?
109.context: NodeContext: player has asked what happened to rolan's face. He has to switch gears form furious, to defensive. Stuuters a little, looks away angrily.

46.speaker: Player
46.text: I know the marks of subjugation. Your face - what happened?
46.context: NodeContext: player has asked what happened to rolan's face. He has to switch gears form furious, to defensive. Stuuters a little, looks away angrily.

22.speaker: Rolan
22.context: NodeContext: player has asked what happened to rolan's face. He has to switch gears form furious, to defensive. Stuuters a little, looks away angrily.

23.speaker: Player
23.text: *His voice catches. There's more going on here than meets the eye.*

73.speaker: Rolan
73.text: *His voice catches. There's more going on here than meets the eye.*

106.speaker: Narrator
106.text: *His voice catches. There's more going on here than meets the eye.*

50.text: You want to buy something? Buy it. Then get out.

87.speaker: Rolan
87.text: You want to buy something? Buy it. Then get out.

40.speaker: Player
40.text: I'll see what you have on offer, then.

136.speaker: Player
136.text: I want to speak to whoever's in charge around here.

139.speaker: Rolan
139.text: Sure. Head on upstairs. Though do be warned, if you don't bring something called the 'Nightsong' with you, your head will be put through a window.

125.speaker: Rolan
125.text: I look forward to seeing it.

26.speaker: Player
26.text: Sorry, I'll leave you in peace.

84.speaker: Rolan
84.text: I have no peace - not anymore.

101.speaker: Player
101.text: I know a beating when I see one. Who knocked you about?

17.speaker: Player
17.text: Did you see Aradin outside? From the druid's grove?

43.speaker: Player
43.text: I know you're upset about Cal and Lia, but I didn't kill them.

4.speaker: Rolan
4.text: True enough. You didn't kill them - just left them to die in that godforsaken tower.

107.speaker: Rolan
107.context: NodeContext: last thing he wants, in the entire world, is to be speaking to the player right now

34.speaker: Player
34.text: I have information on the Nightsong. I want to speak to Lorroakan.
34.context: NodeContext: frustrated, doesn't want to be speaking to the player

67.speaker: Rolan
67.text: Then head upstairs. And be careful - something terrible might happen if you're not paying attention.
67.context: NodeContext: frustrated, doesn't want to be speaking to the player

120.speaker: Rolan
120.text: Welcome back. How can I assist?

149.speaker: Rolan
149.text: You. What are you doing here?
149.context: NodeContext: looks up - sees player. Delighted

30.speaker: Player
30.text: Me? What are you doing here?

60.speaker: Rolan
60.text: It has not been what I expected. Master Lorroakan is... a difficult man.
60.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gently touches bruised face,NodeContext: Gently touches bruised face, distant

112.speaker: Rolan
112.text: He's consumed by his pursuit of the Nightsong. I haven't learnt a thing and I fear it'll stay that way.
112.context: NodeContext: verklempt, thinking of his sister wistfully

104.speaker: Player
104.text: A lucky escape, given Lorroakan's reputation. He'd have little of value to teach you.
104.context: NodeContext: verklempt, thinking of his sister wistfully

45.speaker: Gale
45.text: A lucky escape, given Lorroakan's reputation. He'd have little of value to teach you.
45.context: NodeContext: verklempt, thinking of his sister wistfully

75.speaker: Player
75.text: Lia suspected it might be this way. She was a pain, but she was always right.
75.context: NodeContext: verklempt, thinking of his sister wistfully

111.speaker: Rolan
111.text: Lia suspected it might be this way. She was a pain, but she was always right.
111.context: NodeContext: verklempt, thinking of his sister wistfully

98.speaker: Rolan
98.text: Cal thought this would be everything I wanted. He always was an optimist.
98.context: NodeContext: verklempt, thinking of his sister wistfully

39.speaker: Rolan
39.text: But never mind that. What can I do for you?
39.context: NodeContext: uncomofrtable, trying to be cheery and professional

44.speaker: Player
44.text: You look a bit worse for wear. What happened to your face?
44.context: NodeContext: player has asked about his face (master lorroakan hurt him, but he doesn't want to say).

103.speaker: Rolan
103.text: Nothing for you to worry about.
103.context: NodeContext: player has asked about his face (master lorroakan hurt him, but he doesn't want to say).

150.speaker: Player
150.text: I know the marks of subjugation. Your face - what happened?
150.context: NodeContext: sigh, talking about aradin who caused hassle in the shop earlier

113.speaker: Player
113.text: I know a beating when I see one. Who knocked you about?
113.context: NodeContext: sigh, talking about aradin who caused hassle in the shop earlier

52.speaker: Player
52.text: Did you see Aradin outside? From the druid's grove?
52.context: NodeContext: sigh, talking about aradin who caused hassle in the shop earlier

54.speaker: Rolan
54.text: Aye. We had to remove him from the premises, but unfortunately we couldn't stop him from being a nuisance just outside.
54.context: NodeContext: sigh, talking about aradin who caused hassle in the shop earlier

127.speaker: Rolan
127.text: Can't blame him for taking Lorroakan's contract to retrieve the Nightsong. There's a fortune on offer, and so far no one's been able to claim it.

102.speaker: Player
102.text: Do many people ask about the Nightsong?
102.context: NodeContext: annoyed, rolling eyes - thinks the nightsong is a wild goosechase

65.speaker: Rolan
65.text: It's all I deal with these days - people claiming their trinkets are the 'real Nightsong', looking for the mountain of gold Lorroakan promised.
65.context: NodeContext: annoyed, rolling eyes - thinks the nightsong is a wild goosechase

12.speaker: Rolan
12.text: There's even a pamphlet. Take one - they're on the desk.
12.context: NodeContext: gestures directly in front of him - to the counter

148.speaker: Player
148.text: I have information on the Nightsong.
148.context: NodeContext: sounds a little dissapointed in the player

25.speaker: Rolan
25.text: Be very sure before you make to visit Lorroakan. He's got a beastly temper.
25.context: NodeContext: sounds a little dissapointed in the player

76.speaker: Rolan
76.text: But if you really do know something, he'll want to see you. Head upstairs - you can find the way into his tower up there.

83.speaker: Player
83.text: Nightsong? She's in my camp right now.
83.context: NodeContext: surprised, can't believe the nightsong is a person, and that she's with payer

145.speaker: Rolan
145.text: You must be mistaken. The Nightsong is a relic - something quite ancient, to hear Master Lorroakan talk.
145.context: NodeContext: surprised, can't believe the nightsong is a person, and that she's with payer

135.speaker: Player
135.text: I know Nightsong, actually. Or knew her, at least.

35.speaker: Rolan
35.text: I suppose that, at least, I can help with.

56.speaker: Rolan
56.text: Hope you found what you're looking for.
56.context: NodeContext: A little defeated but still cheerful

71.speaker: Rolan
71.text: Hope you found what you're looking for.
71.context: NodeContext: A little defeated but still cheerful

53.speaker: Player
53.text: I heard this was the place for spellcasting prodigies - why are you here?

27.speaker: Player
27.text: I'm here for sorcerous sundries, of course.
